title: The Frontier in Motion

panel_structure.description: The Great Wall of China impossibly riding atop a massive ocean wave—solid boundaries in perpetual motion, representing how the self's borders are both defined and fluid
panel_structure.focus: Paradox of stable yet moving boundaries

transformation_notes: A stunning visual metaphor—ancient walls riding modern waves. The self isn't a fortress but an ongoing improvisation, boundaries that move because what they contain is alive.
